The #CollegeAffordabilityAct would require accreditors to measure success by using clear federal performance benchmarks and standards. This will ensure all colleges and universities are playing by the same rules in providing opportunity.

For a long time, we‚Äôve had a system that has treated colleges and universities differently, depending on mission, background and history. 

That system isn‚Äôt working.

Historically, #HBCUs have been punished more severely than majority institutions for failing the same standards. We cannot continue to punish HBCUs for trailing in the academic race when they haven‚Äôt had the same starting point. I believe in our HBCUs & the #CAA will protect them

The @usedgov, the states and the accreditors work together to protect students and hold schools accountable. Yet, we‚Äôve seen an influx of for-profit closures while students don‚Äôt see a return on their investment. With the #CollegeAffordabilityAct, we can change that dynamic.

3. There is no constitutional requirement for the House to authorize an impeachment inquiry before such an inquiry commences.
2. There is no need for the public or the President to learn the identity of the #whistleblower.
1. A serious abuse of power while in office is sufficient grounds to warrant impeachment.
To address the arguments of the President and his allies, let me make the following points regarding our #impeachmentinquiry, backed by over 300 Constitutional Law scholars:

10 years ago, the #Veterans Health Care, Budget Reform & Transparency Act was passed, allowing for advance funding to provide services for veterans. Veterans sacrifice a lot to keep us safe and I‚Äôll keep working to ensure that when they come home, their services are protected too

I‚Äôm more interested in numbers that matter: 1 in 3 women experience sexual violence. Only 17% of workers have paid family leave. 56% of girls in grades 7-12 are sexually harassed. For you to have the audacity to compare an honest investigation into your conduct to one of the most heinous acts committed against people, specifically Black people in America, is another example of why you‚Äôre unfit to be President. Your behavior is despicable. #deletethetweet https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1186611272231636992¬†‚Ä¶

The United States needs leadership with integrity ‚Äì people who do the right thing whether they‚Äôre being watched or not. The President lacks the moral competency and decency to represent all Americans. That‚Äôs why I fully support the #impeachmentinquiry.

$85,000,000. That‚Äôs how much our #HBCUs are losing for STEM programs, technological advancements and student assistance as the #FUTUREAct lays dormant in the Senate. The House has done its part ‚Äì it‚Äôs time for the Senate to do theirs.

As legislators, we have a responsibility to pass laws that keep people safe. The Senate‚Äôs inaction to pass HR 8 and HR 1112 to improve & expand background checks for firearm purchases not only demonstrates its carelessness, but its complete disregard for the safety of Americans.

Law enforcement needs tools at its disposal to crack down on illegal gun possession. I introduced the Law Enforcement Needs to Know Act to allow local & state police the ability to receive on-going status notifications of a gun owner‚Äôs criminal actions after a background check.

There have been 88 homicides in Charlotte this year, making 2019 our community‚Äôs deadliest year since 1995. This is unacceptable ‚Äì we must do more to keep guns out of the hands of those who should not have them. I urge my colleagues in the Senate to pass common-sense gun laws.
